analysis: The project uses modern React with TypeScript, Vite, and a component library. The current UI appears to use Radix UI primitives with custom styling. For 'morden-halowen-mobileresponsive', I need to assess the mobile responsiveness and modern UI design. The main areas to focus on are: 1) Mobile viewport meta tag, 2) Responsive breakpoints in CSS, 3) Touch-friendly button sizes, 4) Mobile-optimized form inputs, 5) Card component spacing on mobile.

improvements.description: Add viewport meta tag for mobile responsiveness: <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0, maximum-scale=1.0, user-scalable=no" />
Add responsive breakpoints and mobile-first CSS: @media (max-width: 768px) { .container { padding: 1rem; } button { min-height: 44px; } }
Increase touch target size and add mobile-specific padding: padding: 0.75rem 1.5rem; min-height: 44px; font-size: 1rem;
Add mobile-optimized form spacing and input sizes: input { font-size: 1rem; padding: 0.75rem; } form { gap: 1rem; }
Add mobile-specific card padding and spacing: padding: 1rem; margin: 0.5rem 0; border-radius: 0.5rem;
